Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: Well! It was a different time.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: Ewwww!

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: I did. I got around. Before I met your father, I was a garden variety floozy.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: Why are you telling me this?

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: Because I endured a similar lynching because of a certain dalliance.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: I promise that it was no worse than Marianne Bryant's attack on me.

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: Wanna bet? It was her mother.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: Wait, what?

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: Yep. Don Bryant and I got caught in a very compromising position in the locker room during a basketball game.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: That's disgusting! He's disgusting!

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: He wasn't back then. He was actually pretty handsome. All I'm saying is that MAYBE the reason that Bryant girl is going after you is because her mother told her about me.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: So, the sins of the mother are revisited on the daughter.

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: There's something else you should know. This is hard to say but -- Don Bryant is your father. Marianne is your sister.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: I hate you so much right now. Can't you see I'm a mess!

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: No, you're not, Olive. You're wonderful. And you're going to handle this the same way that I did. With an incontrovertible sense of humor.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: Thanks for the pep talk, Mom. Now get out. I need to make some phone calls.

Speaker: marianne
Dialogue: So, Olive wasn't at school today.

Speaker: rhiannon
Dialogue: Me too. You guys fucking rock.

Speaker: marianne
Dialogue: We don't say that word, Rhiannon.

Speaker: nina
Dialogue: Just say `effing' instead. We effing rock.

Speaker: rhiannon
Dialogue: But isn't that just implying the same word?

Speaker: marianne
Dialogue: Oh, Rhiannon. We have so much to teach you. It's okay to imply things.

Speaker: rhiannon
Dialogue: Yay! It's time for Meerkat Todd.  I just want to rip that costume off him and --

Speaker: marianne
Dialogue: Why don't you just not talk for a while, okay hon?

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: Nobody does it better. Makes me feel sad for the rest. Nobody does it half as good as me. Baby, I'm the best.

Speaker: principal gibbons
Dialogue: Young lady, to my office. NOW.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: Yeah, I can't. I'm gonna go bang my boyfriend while the whole school watches. But good luck with the game-thing. Go Meerkats.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: And here you all are. Waiting outside the closet door for me to kiss Todd, listening to me pretend to have sex with Brandon, paying me to lie for you, calling probably the last virgin in school a whore. Guys. Seriously.

Speaker: meerkat todd
Dialogue: I guessed.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: I see you've been watching my live webcast. It's still going on, you know.

Speaker: meerkat todd
Dialogue: Fuck them. They've had enough of you. Well, figuratively speaking. I borrowed my neighbor's John Deere. Come down here.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: That rhymed.

Speaker: meerkat todd
Dialogue: Intentionally.

Speaker: olive
Dialogue: Be right down.

Speaker: melanie
Dialogue: Told you guys. Pay up.

Dialogue: I thought she was going to take her clothes off.
